item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeMutual aid is rooted in Black and Indigenous resistance to state violence. We cannot allow white organizers,...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeMutual aid is rooted in Black and Indigenous resistance to state violence. We cannot allow white organizers, non-profits, and philanthropists to co-opt our teachings in a time of panic.

briarpatchmagazine.com

The co-option of mutual aid

Mutual aid is rooted in Black and Indigenous resistance to state violence. We cannot allow white organizers, non-profits, and philanthropists to co-opt our teachings in a time of panic.Mutual aid is rooted in Black and Indigenous resistance to state violence. We cannot allow white organizers, non-profits, and philanthropists to co-opt our teachings in a time of panic.

denverite.com

A Lincoln Park plot near Denver Health will be a new safe camping site

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeNelson Mandela“A vote without food, shelter and health care would be to create the appearance of equality...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeNelson Mandela

“A vote without food, shelter and health care would be to create the appearance
of equality while actual inequality is entrenched. We do not want freedom without bread, nor do we want bread without freedom.”

#NelsonMandela
#WorldFoodDay2021
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeHarm Reduction Action CenterThis is our injectable Naloxone drawer. It is looking pretty sad and empty right...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeHarm Reduction Action Center

This is our injectable Naloxone drawer. It is looking pretty sad and empty right now. We are experiencing a shortage in injectable Naloxone in Colorado and nasa...l Narcan is INCREDIBLY expensive at the moment. We're in the worst overdose crisis we have ever seen, and the very last thing we need is a shortage/unavailability of Naloxone. We are spending most of our money on accessing Narcan. Our folks need it. It's lifesaving!
So, what can you do to help? Because most of our money is going towards buying Narcan for our folks, we are quickly running out of money to purchase other necessary items like snacks, water, socks, hygiene, etc. Luckily, we have an Amazon wishlist of all the items we need! You can find our wishlist here: https://a.co/2brD29C
You can also donate directly to HRAC to help us purchase Naloxone TODAY: https://harmreductionactioncenter.wedid.it/
❤️❤️Please check out our wishlist link or donate directly if you are willing and able to help!❤️❤️

See more
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeAbolish ICE DenverI’m a third generation survivor 🧡 - Every child matters 🧡... Today is the Day for...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeAbolish ICE Denver

I’m a third generation survivor 🧡

-

Every child matters 🧡

...

Today is the Day for Truth and Reconciliation, also known as Orange Shirt Day. If you’re an Indigenous ally, take this day [and every day] to learn more about the historical and current realities of Indigenous Peoples 🪶

-

For content on Residential Schools, visit the following sites:

https://legacyofhope.ca

https://nctr.ca/…/teaching-reso…/residential-school-history/

https://education.afn.ca/…/learning-mo…/residential-schools/

-

#EveryChildMatters #ResidentialSchools #TruthBeforeReconciliation #OrangeShirtDay #MoreThanOneDay

See more

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeCity and County of Denver GovernmentWant to earn extra income by sharing space in your home? Sunshine Home...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeCity and County of Denver Government

Want to earn extra income by sharing space in your home? Sunshine Home Share Colorado matches someone seeking housing with someone 55 or older. This program hel...ps older adults gain companionship and stay in their homes, while renters can exchange supportive services like lawn mowing and household chores for affordable rent. Email BTW50plus@denvergov.org to join Denver Economic Development & Opportunity for a September 1 webinar.

See more

Denver's STAR program, sending mental health pros on certain calls instead of police officers, is about to get bigger

item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeElyria Swansea could get a bulk of the money from a proposed $450 million bond package. But it's money not necessarily going where residents – or members of City Council – want it to go.

But it's money not necessarily going where residents – or members of City Council – want it to go.Elyria Swansea could get a bulk of the money from a proposed $450 million bond package. item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeA year after George Floyd’s murder and the summer of protests that followed, communities and law...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeA year after George Floyd’s murder and the summer of protests that followed, communities and law enforcement in places like Northeast Park Hill in Denver are wondering what approach is the right one.

cpr.org

As Crime Rises In Denver, One Historically Black Neighborhood Considers What It Wants From Police

A year after George Floyd’s murder and the summer of protests that followed, communities and law enforcement in places like Northeast Park Hill in Denver are wondering what approach is the right one.A year after George Floyd’s murder and the summer of protests that followed, communities and law enforcement in places like Northeast Park Hill in Denver are wondering what approach is the right one.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeViolence in Denver so far this year is on track to meet or exceed the bloodshed of 2020, when the city...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeViolence in Denver so far this year is on track to meet or exceed the bloodshed of 2020, when the city recorded the highest number of homicides since 1981.

denverpost.com

For second year in a row, Denver homicides and shootings on pace to meet levels of bloodshed not seen in decades

Violence in Denver so far this year is on track to meet or exceed the bloodshed of 2020, when the city recorded the highest number of homicides since 1981.Violence in Denver so far this year is on track to meet or exceed the bloodshed of 2020, when the city recorded the highest number of homicides since 1981.

Tomorrow's #PrideWasAnUprising #Autonomous #MutualAid #CommunityFair has been consolidated to one day (TOMORROW!!!) and the requested donation list has been upd...ated.

We hope to see you tomorrow from 10am-5pm at Cheesman Park! 🏳️‍🌈🚩⚧️🏳️‍⚧️🏴‍☠️

Drop offs accepted through tomorrow at Nooch | Vegan Market

Please contribute what you can! 🌈Venmo .com / We_Protect_Us

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeColorado Village CollaborativeThanks so much to everyone who has been supporting Colorado Village...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeColorado Village Collaborative

Thanks so much to everyone who has been supporting Colorado Village Collaborative and partners with the current SOS site moves, and those who supported the buil...d of the original SOS sites.

We move to Regis University in exactly one week, and are asking for your help in the final push over the next few days. Please use the SignUpGenius link below to sign up for volunteering this weekend and for the move on June 1st. https://www.signupgenius.com/go/9040b45a5ae2baa8-safe

Additionally, we still have some openings to provide meals to our residents at Regis University. Please consider signing up to do so here: https://www.mealtrain.com/trains/723092

See more
